definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: The implication was that there was no meaningful shortfall in client funds.
sentences.chinese: 言下之意是客户资金不存在真正意义上的亏空。

sentences.english: Other, do not spend all ah.
sentences.chinese: 言下之意是，你们不要把钱花光呀。

sentences.english: Keefer knew it meant that they were not options traders.
sentences.chinese: 科夫明白，言下之意就是他们不交易期权。

sentences.english: The implication seems to BE we have to do some extra work today.
sentences.chinese: 那言下之意似乎是我们今天得加班了。

sentences.english: Notice the speech idea of bottom more.
It would appear that Beatrice understood him. There came a deep flush to her cheek;
sentences.chinese: 比阿特丽丝显然明白他言下之意，脸上泛起一股红潮。

sentences.english: It seems that this is your "unknown source" The implication?
sentences.chinese: 看来这就是你们说的“来源地不明”的言下之意了？

sentences.english: Sue says, " Fine, be my guest, " meaning okay, you go ahead and you plan the vacation.
sentences.chinese: 言下之意是，就让你制定度假计划好了。

definition: unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
unspoken dialogue in a play, left for the audience to infer/subtext/(fig.) implicit assertion
needless to say/it goes without saying
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
